Posts.Content: Grogg, whilst I hear what is being said about this being fed back in house, like any charity if people feel strongly enough to want to do something you can email or write to the chief exec or trustees and like all complaints set out how you would like to see it resolved. However the history of the site is not always one of responding to patients when change is made, many have left the community over the years due to their frustration with mac not listening. bowing out now john
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Maggie, the lymphoma ass. have a video on youtube here is the link, so good stuff on there https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kltoemocHE&feature=youtu.be and yes had it for over 5yrs and still got it, but you learn to live with it and learn to laugh about it, the more you struggle the harder it becomes, a bit like Tony I have done some really stupid things in the kitchen when putting things away or going to get something. Doing word games and other testing puzzles will help john
Posts.Title: chemo fog
